Close.definition: to bring to an end or to a state of completion [ closed the case] [ an estate by liquidating its assets] [ closing his account] 2

1.definition: to enter into or complete an agreement (as for the sale of real estate) [theyon the house]

2.definition: to come to an end or to a state of completion [after the class, the trust shall continue…until the death of the last surviving member of the class ""]nan enclosed area [break another's ]
